description: A legendary black blade and one of the 21 Great Grade swords (大業物 Ō Wazamono). It was once wielded by the legendary samurai Shimotsuki Ryuma and is considered a national treasure of Wano Country. The blade was turned black through countless battles, a testament to Ryuma's mastery.

keyMoments.title: Passed to Zoro
keyMoments.description: After being defeated, Ryuma sheathes Shusui and throws it to Zoro, recognizing him as a worthy successor to wield the legendary blade.
keyMoments.significance: Zoro acquires one of the most powerful swords in the One Piece world, replacing his broken Yubashiri.

specialAbilities: Increased cutting power due to black blade status
Enhanced durability - cannot be bent or damaged easily
Heavier than normal katana, adding force to strikes
properties.appearance: A curved katana with a black blade, a cross-shaped tsuba (guard), and a distinctive handle wrap

historicalSignificance: Wielded by Shimotsuki Ryuma, the legendary 'Sword God' who protected Wano Country and slayed a dragon over the Flower Capital. The sword was stolen from Ryuma's grave by Gecko Moria 23 years before the current timeline and placed in his zombie body.
culturalContext: National treasure of Wano Country, representing the pinnacle of swordsmithing and the legacy of one of Wano's greatest heroes.

trivia.fact: Shusui is one of the very few black blades in the One Piece world, turned black through Ryuma's countless battles and mastery of Haki.
Zoro would later return Shusui to Wano Country in exchange for Enma during the Wano Arc, honoring the sword's cultural significance to the people of Wano.

sources.title: Why Did Zoro Part with Shusui? The Significance of His Choice

trivia.fact: The sword's name 'Shusui' (秋水) literally means 'Autumn Water' in Japanese.
